basics.name: Ioana-Andreea Grapa
basics.label: Event Manager
basics.summary: I am a creative, dynamic and organised event manager who enjoys bringing people together to share common passions. Sociable, enthusiastic and a doer, I look for challenges at every corner. I love travelling, am a huge foodie and love being outdoors. It is my belief that travelling and acquiring international experience has an immense impact on an individual's ability of integrating in a changing and dynamic environment, creating confident social networks and becoming open-minded towards future projects. In addition, travelling nurtures my interest for cross-cultural experiences, which impact on habits, behaviour, beliefs and values.

work.summary: I have autonomously project managed Twilio’s sponsored participation in several tech events in Germany (Berlin, Hannover, Munich) and co-organised Twilio’s sponsorship at Mobile World Congress (Barcelona). With an yearly allocated budget of €200,000, my main responsibilities involved securing sponsorship contracts, designing expo booths and collateral, conducting email marketing campaigns, on-site networking, logistical support and internal reporting. Supported Twilio by improving brand awareness, engaging with attendees and generating over 500 leads through events in the German market.

Having managed a community of 27,000 data enthusiasts, I fully organised, ran and spoke at the largest Big Data Meetups across 16 European cities. I have also lead the organisation of the annual Data Natives Conference, which attracted over 1000 attendees in Berlin & Tel Aviv, with a budget of €150,000. Sold and secured sponsorship for various events from companies like IBM, Deloitte, HPE and Google, among others.

I have maintained and developed the MC Agency Network and its foreign subsidiaries in South Asia and the Middle East. Conducted research, copywriting and additional creative support for international partnerships within the public relations field. Forged partnerships with agencies in various industries including Advertising, Media, Corporate Publishing, Youth/Sport/Music Marketing and Event Management.

Instructed the 3rd year course “Contemporary Issues in the Entertainment Industry” in the Sport and Event Management Department. Created course plans, lectures, seminars, graded papers and conducted office hours for a class of 16 students with full autonomy. Voted Best University Course in the 2014 student survey.

I have promoted Coventry University internationally by conducting and hosting Introduction Days abroad. I developed new strategies with the management team of the International Office to successfully increase enrolment rates. Also, I created the promotional presentation and film for the Sports and Event Management Department Introduction Days.
